title: Google Workspace launches annual plans, 20% price increase for monthly users
description: Higher prices are live for new users; existing user prices increase next month.

title: Here’s why slashing insulin prices will actually save Big Pharma money
description: The cuts will kick in just as a federal cap on Medicaid payments is eliminated.

title: Report: Microsoft cut a key AI ethics team
description: Expert calls decision "damning," says it's time for regulators to get involved.

title: Here’s our first look at Kia’s EV9 three-row electric SUV
description: The EV9 was designed with American tastes in mind and goes on sale later this year.

title: Microsoft signs another Call of Duty deal in bid to impress regulators
description: Microsoft says Boosteroid deal should make cross-platform intent "clear to regulators."

title: Still using authenticators for MFA? Software for sale can hack you anyway
description: Some forms of multi-factor authentication only go so far in preventing account takeovers.

title: Gov’t opens $2.5 billion for EV chargers in rural and underserved areas
description: This is in addition to $5 billion being spent on fast chargers along highways.

title: Check out the winners of this year’s Gallery of Soft Matter Physics
description: Submissions were judged on both striking visual qualities and scientific interest.

title: Microsoft Teams is adding 3D avatars for people who want to turn their webcams off
description: "Microsoft Mesh" features like avatars were originally slated to launch in 2022.

title: Amazon unveils three satellite user terminals, plans broadband service in 2024
description: Amazon Kuiper terminals come in three sizes, with max speeds from 100Mbps to 1Gbps.

title: OpenAI announces GPT-4, its next-generation AI language model
description: Multimodal AI model can process images and text; pass bar exams.

title: Do better coders swear more, or does C just do that to good programmers?
description: For open source C code, curses mean quality, a recent bachelor’s thesis suggests.

title: Did Oregon once host a nesting colony of pterosaurs?
description: A fossil site may contain guano washed into the oceans from a pterosaur colony.

title: Google shows off what ChatGPT would be like in Gmail and Google Docs
description: Google will bring generative AI to Workspace, but a public launch sounds far off.

title: Ransomware attacks have entered a heinous new phase
description: Cybercriminal gangs now releasing stolen photos of cancer patients, student records.

title: System Shock gets May 30 PC release date after successful demo
description: It's been a long road since the project's 2016 Kickstarter funding.

title: Meta to lay off another 10,000 as Zuckerberg celebrates “year of efficiency”
description: After over-hiring, Zuckerberg says staff cuts taught him that "leaner is better."

title: Only four midsize SUVs score good rating in IIHS rear-seat safety tests
description: IIHS crash-tested 13 midsize SUVs with a test dummy sitting in the back seat.

title: TikTok accused of mishandling sexual harassment allegations
description: Woman’s employment ended after probe into complaint about advances made by manager.

title: Waze route plans will now include electric vehicle charger locations
description: EV drivers now have one more option for planning the best route with charging.

title: Why it does and doesn’t matter if Google, Microsoft, or Zoom certify your webcam
description: PC accessory stamps should emphasize features, not compatibility/marketing.
